results.title: Save the Earth, feed the world
results.creator_credit: Edwin Scragg, Veronica Young, Jane West, Andrew Liebman, Film Australia, Chedd-Angier Productions and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Race to save the planet”.
This program examines world food production and the challenge of feeding a growing population. The program discusses the environmental damage caused by conventional, intensive farming in both industrial and developing countries and the worldwide movement to replace conventional methods with low-input, sustainable agricultural practices. Narrated by Karina Kelly. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edwin Scragg, Veronica Young, Jane West, Andrew Liebman, Film Australia, Chedd-Angier Productions and WGBH (Boston)

results.title: Remnants of Eden
results.creator_credit: Christopher McCullough, Film Australia, Chedd-Angier Productions and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Race to save the planet”.
This program examines the possibility that this generation may preside over a biological mass extinction of half the species on earth today. It addresses the delicate balance of protecting life’s diversity whilst managing the needs of growing human populations. Examples are taken from Kenya, United States, Thailand, Oman and Costa Rica. Narrated by Karina Kelly. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christopher McCullough, Film Australia, Chedd-Angier Productions and WGBH (Boston)

results.title: In the name of progress
results.creator_credit: Katherine Carpenter, Film Australia, Chedd-Angier Productions and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Race to save the planet”.
This program examines well-intended development projects in the third world and the environmental disasters that resulted, and questions whether environmental protection and economic development are inherently in conflict. It profiles ‘sustainable development’ alternatives in Brazil and India. Narrated by Karina Kelly. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Katherine Carpenter, Film Australia, Chedd-Angier Productions and WGBH (Boston)

results.title: Do we really want to live this way?
results.creator_credit: Marty Ostrow, Film Australia, Chedd-Angier Productions and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Race to save the planet”.
This program examines the pollution problems associated with the world’s most affluent societies and includes case studies of air quality in Los Angeles and water quality in the Rhine River Basin. Narrated by Karina Kelly. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.

results.title: The Enforcer
results.creator_credit: Brent Productions, Milton Sperling and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Humphrey Bogart portrays District Attorney Martin Ferguson whose efforts to crack an organised crime syndicate are jeopardised by the suicide of his sole eyewitness on the eve of the trial. Ferguson has only 12 hours to prepare a new case in order to bring crime boss Albert Mendoza (Everett Sloane) to justice. A suspenseful thriller written by Martin Rackin and based on the ‘Murder Inc.’ case. Cast also includes Zero Mostel, Ted De Corsia, Roy Roberts and Lawrence Tolan. Music by David Buttolph, cinematography by Robert Burks and editing by Fred Allen.

results.title: Only One Atmosphere
results.creator_credit: Andrew Liebman, John Angier, Film Australia, Chedd-Angier Productions and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Race to save the planet”.
This program examines the new understanding of how human activities are altering the earth’s atmosphere. It explores damage to the ozone layer and the greenhouse effect, noting the probable consequences of these changes, and concludes by considering how societies can respond. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.

results.title: The Environmental revolution
results.creator_credit: John Angier, Carol Lynn Dornbrand, Film Australia, Chedd-Angier Productions and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Race to save the planet”.
This introductory episode examines the two major revolutions that have changed how human societies use resources - the agricultural and industrial revolutions. It then suggests that a third revolution - a global awareness of human impacts - is beginning to cause equally far-reaching changes in society. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.

results.title: The Energy carol
results.creator_credit: Les Drew, Sidney Goldsmith, Wolf Koenig, Conservation and Renewable Energy Branch, Energy, Mines and Resources Canada and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated film dealing with conservation of energy resources. Ebenezer Scrooge has a motto: to waste is to grow. His motto becomes: back to basics. “The Energy carol” traces this momentous transformation, and introduces us to the spirits of energy past, present and future (Award: New York)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Les Drew, Sidney Goldsmith, Wolf Koenig, Conservation and Renewable Energy Branch, Energy, Mines and Resources Canada and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Enemy within (2003) [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Eva Colmers, Jerry Krepakevich, Bonnie Thompson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In World War II thousands of German prisoners-of-war were sent to camps in Canada where they saw out the war, many for several years. This documentary examines the experiences of a few of those men, as well as presenting the perspectives of the Canadian guards. Filmmaker Eva Colmers (a German-born resident of Canada) focuses on the story of her father - a POW who has fond memories of his time in captivity. If this seems disingenuous, it is through a series of interviews that he reveals that he was well fed, well treated and educated during his confinement. Of interest here is also the workings of a POW camp — how the men strictly adhered to their rank and values as soldiers, even remaining loyal to Hitler. What is clear is that they were treated with respect that fostered loyalty, to the point where the prisoners were released to work on farms, and as lumberjacks, and were even allowed at times, to wander beyond the barbwire. Overall this is a fascinating tale that mixes interviews with archival footage, thus presenting a very humanistic slant on what was a cruel and murderous time in history.

results.title: The End of violence
results.creator_credit: Wim Wenders, Nicholas Klein, Deepak Nayar, Kintop Pictures, Road Movies Filmproduktion and CiBy 2000
results.brief_description:
A film about conspiracy, the effects of violence in our culture, and personal transformation. Mike Max is a leading Hollywood producer, whose triumph has come from a string of extremely violent action films. His work is his life, and he neglects his wife in his pursuit of success. Frustrated with his lack of attention, she leaves him, and Max is forced to admit he was a less-than supportive husband. Not long after, he becomes involved in a violent killing, and fearing for his life, goes into hiding, falling victim to a new top-secret surveillance system that caught the crime on camera. Escaping into L.A.’s underworld, Max confronts violence more terrifying than anything he could put on film.

Credits: Producers, Deepak Nayer, Nicholas Klein ; director, Wim Wenders ; writer, Nicholas Klein ; photography, Pascal Rabaud ; music, Ry Cooder ; editing, Peter Pryzygodda.
Cast: Bill Pullman, Andie MacDowell, Traci Lind, Rosalind Chao, K. Todd Freeman, Gabriel Byrne.

results.description:
A film about conspiracy, the effects of violence in our culture, and personal transformation. Mike Max is a leading Hollywood producer, whose triumph has come from a string of extremely violent action films. His work is his life, and he neglects his wife in his pursuit of success. Frustrated with his lack of attention, she leaves him, and Max is forced to admit he was a less-than supportive husband. Not long after, he becomes involved in a violent killing, and fearing for his life, goes into hiding, falling victim to a new top-secret surveillance system that caught the crime on camera. Escaping into L.A.’s underworld, Max confronts violence more terrifying than anything he could put on film.

Cast: Bill Pullman, Andie MacDowell, Traci Lind, Rosalind Chao, K. Todd Freeman, Gabriel Byrne.
